comment: She is a great professor! Class is mandatory and there is a lot of busy work at first but it slows down as the semester goes on. The work can seem annoying but she never assigns more than you can handle and she wants to help you if you need it. Attendance is necessary if you want to pass. She's reasonable and fair. Strongly recommend!

Professor Durden is an amazing seminar teacher. She is very clear about what she expects from you and she presents the material in a straightforward manner. There are a few projects/papers including a group presentation, however, she gives you plenty of time to complete the assignments. The quizzes are online and open book as well. I recommend her!

I wish I could have this professor for every single class I ever have to take. The semester will seem a little tough at the beginning but it's completely worth it and she teaches you SO many important life lessons. It's for sure not an easy A, but the projects are always fun. She gives AMAZING feedback and will be there to listen to you and help.

KSU Seminar was a very enjoyable class thanks to Professor Durden. You will learn things from managing your time to discovering your true major in college, all while interacting with your fellow classmates. Show up to class, complete the quizzes and assignments on time, and participate in class. Do this and you'll have no problem receiving an A!

KSU Seminar 1101 was an extremely enjoyable class. You will learn things from managing your time to discovering your true major, all while interacting with fellow students who are engaged in various majors different from your own. Professor Durden made Seminar an enjoyable class for all those who were engaged in their learning environment.

Professor Durden is a wonderful professor and person. She starts off with some busy work, but it eases off as the semester goes by. Quizzes are open book and there are no tests. She makes participation and attendance required, but her class in fun. She tells lots of stories and teaches you real world information. Totally recommend taking her.

Professor Durden is an awesome teacher for First-Year Seminar. She is an expert in this field and she always knows exactly what she is talking about. She is passionate and she relates things from class to the world itself. Group work is very important in class and it's good because she helps you and your classmates get to know each other.

She has high hopes for her students but isn't too hard. She's very straight forward and makes the course easy to understand. I loved her enthusiaism and care towards her students. She's seemed to be a lot harder than she actually is. If you do the assignments and follow the rubrics you'll do fine.

Got an A in this class, but Prof D makes you work for it. There are no tests, the quizzes for each section you take online, and the final is in class but she gives you the questions beforehand. Projects will take up most of your grade. Projects are sometimes complicated, but doable. Prof D is pretty intense, but be respectful and you'll do fine.

Professor Durden is a great teacher. She is an expert at everything she if teaching you and wants you to succeed. She knows her stuff, goes in depth to help students understand, and holds you accountable. After 3 absences you fail. hard greater but is very clear on what she wants. would take again. Gave me a new perspective of KSU
